headline: The Warner Discovery Bidding War Is Heating Up. Who Stands to Win.
summary: The victor will walk away with the rights to beloved characters including Harry Potter, Superman, and Tony Soprano.

headline: Netflix stock falls amid scrutiny of potential Warner Bros. Discovery bid
summary: Investing.com -- Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) stock declined 2.7% Wednesday as investors weighed the strategic implications and regulatory hurdles of its reported interest in acquiring Warner Bros. Discovery’s studio and streaming assets.

raw.headline: Netflix stock falls amid scrutiny of potential Warner Bros. Discovery bid
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) stock declined 2.7% Wednesday as investors weighed the strategic implications and regulatory hurdles of its reported interest in acquiring Warner Bros. Discovery’s studio and streaming assets.

headline: Who will win the race to buy Warner Bros Discovery?
summary: Investing.com -- The contest to acquire Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) is accelerating, with Bernstein analyst Laurent Yoon noting that “first-round, non-binding bids for WBD … are due in a couple of days,” drawing interest from at least three potential buyers: PSKY, NFLX and CMCSA.

raw.headline: Who will win the race to buy Warner Bros Discovery?

headline: JPMorgan’s Super-Sized Checks Are Blowing Away All Other Lenders
summary: Time and again, the firm has overwhelmed private credit managers and Wall Street rivals with substantial financing packages to win coveted debt deals.  Then it stepped up $17.5 billion to help Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. split itself in two.  After Silver Lake Management’s Egon Durban called JPMorgan Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon, seeking assurance his bank had the conviction to commit the necessary funds, it took just 11 days to iron out the deal.

raw.headline: JPMorgan’s Super-Sized Checks Are Blowing Away All Other Lenders

headline: Paramount Is the Only Logical Winner in the Three-Horse Race for Warner
summary: HEARD ON THE STREET  “Top Gun Meets Harry Potter” might bomb as a pitch for a movie. As a deal pitch, though, it strangely works.  The famed Warner Bros. studio is officially on the block, as are HBO, CNN, Turner Broadcasting, DC Comics, the Discovery Channel and other businesses owned by Warner Bros Discovery   Just 3½ years old, the media conglomerate is holding an auction process with a deadline for the first round of nonbinding bids set for Thursday.

headline: Here's the latest on the Warner Bros. Discovery sale
summary: David Faber breaks down the latest details on the sale of Warner Bros. Discovery, who the biggest contenders could be, and much more.

headline: 'Great opportunity' for Saudi Arabia's PIF to invest in Warner Bros Discovery: Strategist
summary: John Blank, Chief Equity Strategist at Zacks Investment Research, discusses reports that Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund PIF is looking to acquire legacy media giant Warner Brothers Discovery. He explains why it would be a 'great opportunity' for PIF to acquire such a 'marquee' asset and build scale.
